TextpageLeftNav.bodyText:
Data Transfer

Data Transfer means that data is moved in and out of Azure Data Centers that are not explicitly covered by Content Delivery Network pricing.

Pricing Details

Input and output of data:

Users of the 1RMB Trial receive 50GB of free data. In the event of excess of the Data Transfer usage limit, the customer's account will be suspended without prior notice and the free credit limit will be set to "0". You can click here to check your data usage in real time.

Starting June 1, 2016, official paying users will enjoy the first 1TB (1024GB) of data free of charge each month when using incoming Data Transfer services. Users in excess of 1TB of free data will be charged at the following Data Transfer rates.

Input data (data transmission into the data center): ￥ 0.67/GB

Output data (data transmission from the data center): ￥ 0.67/GB

FAQ

Expand All
  • Is there a fee for data transfer between Azure services located in the same region (China East or China North)?

    No. For example, data transfer within an Azure SQL Database in the same region (China East or China North) will not incur any additional costs.

  • Is there a fee for data transfer between Azure services located in two different regions (China East or China North)?

    Yes, input and output data between various Azure services located in two different regions (China East or China North) needs to be charged according to the pricing.

Support & SLA

If you have any questions or need help, please visit Azure Support to select self-service or any other methods to contact us for support.

Data transfer doesn’t provide a Service Level Agreement. If you want to learn about the details of our server level agreement, please access the Service Levels Agreements page.

TextpageLeftNav.metaDescription: Learn about the pricing details of Azure Data Transfer. Data transfer means that data is moved in and out of Azure Data Centers that are not explicitly covered by Content Delivery Network pricing. A 1RMB Trial gets you ￥ 1,500 in service credits, or you can become an Azure Pay-in-Advance user through direct purchasing and enjoy the highest 99.99% Service Level Agreement.
